alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Scotts Bluff. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Mitchell, Terrytown, Morrill, Minatare, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Alice, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Wildcat Hills Campground, Hubbard Hill, Lake Minatare Campground, Lake Minatare, Melbeta and McGrew. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
